snippet: Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan is expected to win Sunday’s presidential vote and transform an office that has been largely ceremonial.
abstract: Turkish Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan is widely anticipated to win country's first presidential election, event that would strengthen his political influence; if victorious, Erdogan is expected to transform largely ceremonial office, expanding its clout and ensuring greater legacy for himself.

byline.original: By SEBNEM ARSU and TIM ARANGO
byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu reported from Ankara and Mersin, Turkey, and Tim Arango from Baghdad. Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan is expected to win Sunday’s presidential vote and transform an office that has been largely ceremonial.

headline.main: Turkey’s Premier Tries to Keep Power, as President
headline.print_headline: Premier Tries to Keep Power, as President
